quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Type and Game
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, mean, cubic. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of diamond is the rarest on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: What does the name of the Koh-i-Noor diamond mean in Persian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mountain of light

questions.question: What country are the priciest emeralds in the world found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colombia

questions.question: Name the first NFL team to win the Super Bowl indoors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas

questions.question: Where was the largest aquamarine stone found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil

questions.question: What was the first US city to play a Beatles song on the radio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seattle

questions.question: What type of topaz is the gemstone of Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue topaz

questions.question: Which of these names refers to the precious stone morganite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What branch of philosophy or metaphysics deals with the study of being and existence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ontology

questions.question: In which of these colors do sapphires come?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What statement is true about the precious stone opal?

options.text: White and green opals are the most common.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In the Hawaiian language this word means woman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wahine (wah-hee-knee)

questions.question: As a cheaper substitute for which of these precious stones is the synthetic cubic zirconia used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diamond

questions.question: Who was  the first Major League Baseball player to hit four homers in one game and three triples in another game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie Mays

questions.question: The name of the ruby comes from the Latin word ruber, which means what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Fear and City
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, origin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Acrophobia is the fear of flying.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: When expressed by a medical term, containing the word phobia, which one of these has the most letters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the fear of long words

questions.question: People suffering from pediophobia would be afraid of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabbage patch kids

questions.question: Aichmophobia is defined as an abnormal fear of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pointy objects

questions.question: D-Day refers to one of the biggest military operations in history that took place on June 6, 1944. What was the pass word used by the Allied Forces on that day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mickey Mouse

questions.question: This American city was the site of the first musicians union in the USA. Its zoo housed the lion that roared before every MGM movie. It is called Bluff City. Although it is the largest city in the state it has never been the state capital. What is this city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memphis

questions.question: The TV show Medium revolves around a psychic consultant named Allison Du Bois. True or False: The character is named after a real life psychic consultant called Allison DuBois.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Amathophobia is an irrational fear of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dust particles

questions.question: What is the term for a small, thin piece of skin, especially the skin that comes off the body after a sunburn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: blype

questions.question: Which of the following terms refers to the abnormal fear of walking or standing erect?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basiphobia

questions.question: The word phobia is of Latin origin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where does the name Kansas come from?

options.text: from the Chinook word for the area
from an Apache word meaning small rivers
from the indigenous people of that area of the USA
from a Huron word meaning long space

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: from the indigenous people of that area of the USA

questions.question: Identical twins have identical fingerprints.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This award-winning composer/arranger has written and arranged the themes for St. Elsewhere, Law and Order, NYPD Blue, Toma, The Rockford Files and several other great TV shows.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Post

questions.question: Which insect would a myrmecophobic person want to stay away from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ants

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actress and England
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, ford, porter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following did Henry Ford not put into his first cars?

options.text: A place for a second person to sit in front

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reverse gear

questions.question: Which of these literary works was not written by author Jane Austen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wuthering Heights

questions.question: Peladophobia is the fear of this type of people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: balding people

questions.question: Jane Porter is the love interest of this fictional character.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tarzan

questions.question: Fashion house Hermes named their famous Birkin bag after Jane Birkin. Who is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an English actress and singer

questions.question: Jane Marple, better known as Miss Marple, is a fictional amateur detective created by this famous author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agatha Christie

questions.question: Lady Jane Grey was the uncrowned Queen of England for what period of time in 1553?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nine days

questions.question: Which of the Bronte sisters wrote the famous novel Jane Eyre?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlotte Bronte

questions.question: What is the birth name of Academy Award-winning actress Jane Fonda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Jayne Seymour Fonda

questions.question: This American beauty was born Marion Levy in New York. She acted in such great movies as The Great Dictator, Modern Times, So Proudly We Hailed, and A Stranger Came Home. Who was this actress whose husbands included Charlie Chaplin, Burgess Meredith and Erich Maria Remarque?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paulette Goddard

questions.question: This American-born soprano, nicknamed the Tennessee Nightingale, lived 1898-1947. She was nominated for an Oscar for One Night of Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grace Moore

questions.question: This very popular opera singer from Australia lived 1861-1931. She had two foods named after her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nellie Melba

questions.question: Jane Addams is the founder of this movement in the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Settlement House movement

questions.question: How did Jane Seymour, wife of King Henry VIII of England, die in 1537?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Of natural causes

questions.question: In what 1973 James Bond movie has actress Jane Seymour appeared as a Bond girl?

options.text: The Man with the Golden Gun

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Live and Let Die

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Man and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1930s, ehe Dust Bowl directly affected these four US states.

options.text: Texas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, and Colorado

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, and Colorado

questions.question: Which word is defined as “the spiritual attitude of a man to a god and a dog to a man” in Ambrose Bierces satirical book The Devils Dictionary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reverence

questions.question: What was the original source of the Hearst fortune?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mining

questions.question: Dwight David Eisenhower was a great US General and the 34th President of the USA. He had thoughts of becoming a football player until he was injured tackling this great athlete.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Thorpe

questions.question: Which of these not only cut off pieces of the American flag, but was honored for doing so?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Peary

questions.question: Which city used to be called Lutetia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris

questions.question: What US college football team plays on blue grass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boise State

questions.question: This actor is a graduate of Harvard University and of the Yale Drama School. In 1997 he married Angela Bassett. He is known for his role as A.D.A. Ron Carver on Law and Order: Criminal Intent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Courtney Vance

questions.question: Which of these is considered the best selling English-language novel of all times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Tale of Two Cities

questions.question: John Steinbeck wrote the highly acclaimed novel The Grapes of Wrath. Where does the title come from?

options.text: The Battle Hymn of the Republic
A famous sermon by Cotton Mather

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Battle Hymn of the Republic

questions.question: Who was the first player for the Tampa Bay (Devil) Rays?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Saunders

questions.question: The  first computer used for weather research and prediction was MANIAC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where would one find the worlds largest vulture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Andes

questions.question: The Stegasaurus had a second brain in its back.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the softest mineral?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Talc

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Definition and Book
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, potato, gospel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What other name is commonly used to refer to sweet and sour sauce in China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The peoples sauce

questions.question: What Biblical prophet inspired the popular gospel song Swing Low, Sweet Chariot, composed by Wallace Willis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elijah

questions.question: What was the original name of the British rock band Sweet before they adopted their final name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sweetshop

questions.question: What band released Bitter Sweet Symphony on 16 June, 1997 as the first single from their third album Urban Hymns?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Verve

questions.question: “The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather and exposing them to the critic” is satirist Ambrose Bierce’s definition for which of these activities?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Painting

questions.question: “Appointing your grandmother to office for the good of the party” is the definition of which of these words in the satirical book by Ambrose Bierce The Devils Dictionary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nepotism

questions.question: In Ambrose Bierces satirical book The Devils Dictionary, what is called “one of the sauces which serve the French in place of a state religion”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mayonaise

questions.question: Match this definition to the word it belongs in Ambrose Bierce’s book The Devils Dictionary: “a machine which you go into as a pig and come out of as a sausage.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Litigation

questions.question: Which is the word this definition from Ambrose Bierce’s book The Devils Dictionary refers to: “A man whose qualities, prepared for display like a box of berries in a market -- the fine ones on top -- have been opened on the wrong side. An inverted gentleman”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blackguard

questions.question: The sweet potato is commonly mistaken for this other plant, although the two are not related.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yam

questions.question: Which verb is defined as “to put forward a suitable person to incur the mudgobbling and deadcatting of the opposition” in Ambrose Bierce’s satirical book The Devils Dictionary
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nominate

questions.question: Which of these words is defined as the one unpardonable sin against ones fellows in the book The Devils Dictionary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Success

questions.question: What is the full name of Charity, the leading character from the popular Broadway musical Sweet Charity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charity Hope Valentine

questions.question: Which quality does satirist Ambrose Bierce define as “hideously appareled after the manner of the time and place” in his book The Devils Dictionary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Handsome

questions.question: Match this definition to the word it belongs to according to Ambrose Bierce’s book The Devils Dictionary: “The state or condition of a community consisting of a master, a mistress and two slaves, making in all, two.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marriage

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Title and World
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, title, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the title of a 1973 song by The Rolling Stones?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver Train

questions.question: When did the first balloon flight in the USA take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1793

questions.question: In Australia the expression silvertail is used as a synonym of which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wealthy

questions.question: Name the 1985 horror movie based on the novella Cycle of the Werewolf by Stephen King.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver Bullet

questions.question: What is the name of Marilyn Mansons 1995 remix album in which he included his cover of Eurythmics 1983 Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Smells Like Children

questions.question: What was the first jet fighter to hit Mach 3.2?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MIG 25 Foxbat

questions.question: Which wedding anniversary is celebrated as Silver Wedding Day by old tradition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 25th anniversary

questions.question: Which statement is true about King Bladud?

options.text: He is the mythical king who tried to fly with wings made out of feathers and wood.
He was the first member of a royal house (Ottoman Empire) to fly in a plane.
He flew the first plane to fly in Asia. (Thailand)
He was the first primate (chimpanzee) to be onboard a spacecraft.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is the mythical king who tried to fly with wings made out of feathers and wood.

questions.question: U2s song Sweetest Thing was reportedly written by vocalist Bono as an apology to his wife Ali Hewson for forgetting this.

options.text: Forgetting to pick her mother from the airport

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forgetting her birthday

questions.question: In the world of airplane technology, what does LOT stand  for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Low Observational Technology

questions.question: What is the other common name of the plant Prunus avium, better known as Sweet cherry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild cherry

questions.question: In 2008, how many nations had aircraft carriers either sea worthy or under construction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: In which U.S. state is there a region called Silver?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: What is the meaning of the idiomatic phrase to have a sweet tooth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To be addicted to sweets

questions.question: Which company built the Zero, the top Japanese fighter in World War Two?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitsubishi
